metadata.notes: Merged from 8 manifests. Files with identical content deduplicated (propsygnal_document_intelligence_spec_1.md is duplicate of propsygnal_document_intelligence_spec.md). Counts include all unique source files across all repos.

key_signals: Wave model: 4 waves, 22 items, 7-week critical path, 5 parallel tracks
Critical path: Migration 0005 → BL-002 → BL-001 → BL-005 → BL-016 → BL-011
71 total decisions (52 locked + 8 not-replicating + 3 testing + 7 OQ resolutions)
All 7 open questions resolved as of 2026-02-19
v2 splits DEC-015 into 015a/015b, adds DEC-042 through DEC-052
26 labels: 8 type + 5 wave + 4 priority + 5 track + 4 size
8 dependency fields still need correction per CONSISTENCY-AUDIT-PLANS
21 libraries cataloged (10 backend, 5 frontend, 2 external APIs, 4 GML rendering)
Authoritative: chart library is Plotly.js (not Recharts)
Superagent parity = Platform Primitives (not research module)
Domain modules (Lease CDs, Debt MVP, PropSygnal, RegSygnal) run ON platform
DG-5: async DB session pattern in Send() nodes = hardest technical problem
7 explicitly NOT replicating (v0.app, Firecrawl, FactSet, Ory Kratos, PostHog, Sanity CMS, OneSignal)
10 CLAUDE.md team briefs approved but not yet created
Next.js frontend with custom GML rendering
Data brief pattern: single source of truth
GML healer: exact verbatim extraction from minified bundle
All values extracted from production bundles (HIGH confidence)
No Send() fan-out: #1 gap for Superagent parity
Migration 0004 adds conversation layer (Dify analysis was WRONG)
6-phase timeline is 2x too long (22-39 weeks vs 13 weeks actual)
Infrastructure swap matrix is valuable reference
Browser-use/HITL deferred to v2 inflates estimate
Authority ranking: Ground Truth > Our Analysis > Dify > Codex
6 critical errors (conversation persistence, graph complexity, table count all WRONG)
Valuable: RAG quality roadmap, SSE event specification
Fan-out orchestration is #1 technical gap (all sources agree)
Config-driven UI (JSON descriptors instead of TSX)

files.primary_topic: 27 atomic UI primitives with Zod schemas
key_signals: 27 components: 10 primitive, 8 container, 4 data, 2 media, 2 form, 3 feedback
No inter-primitive imports (composition via children prop)
Single renderDescriptor function handles app + AI output
State path resolver, conditional rendering, loops
17 patterns: ChatMessage, ChatInput, PlanProgress, ReportHeader, NavSidebar, etc.
6 full pages as JSON: home, chat, account, tasks, modal, error

files.primary_topic: 7 AI SDK tools replacing 20-event custom protocol
key_signals: 7 tools: updateResearchPlan, streamReportSection, reportSources, askClarification, browserAgentAction, setChatTitle, renderUI, deployWebsite
No custom streaming protocol; AI SDK handles state machine
Component reduction: 60 React files + 16 GML → 27 primitives + 17 patterns
Streaming: 20 custom events + Redux → 7 AI SDK tools + Zustand
Time to implement: ~1 week MVP, ~2 weeks full parity

files.primary_topic: Streaming engine, data model, and API surface deep analysis
key_signals: WebSocket unused (pristine: true, connected: false) — proves HTTP/ReadableStream is right
18 GML tags with complete schema validation
Complete build specification for NYQST SuperAgent (41 tables, API spec, 7-phase plan)
22 streaming event types documented with exact field maps
30s idle watchdog, 5 retries with exponential backoff
Two independent signals of event-sourcing (ReplayStream, has_async_entities_pending)
Reference architecture: API → Orchestrator → Event log + Entity store + Tool runners
16 GML tags documented: 4 layout, 9 widget, 4 artifact viewer
Healing indicates model frequently produces imperfect nesting
Bash snippet for NDJSON line extraction

files.primary_topic: Overview and reading guide for 5-report series
key_signals: Primary evidence: 3 JS bundles (774-*, 1889-*, _app-*) + feature flags

files.primary_topic: Feature flags, CMS config, analytics bootstrap
Knowledge and context management system architecture
key_signals: Insights as first-class entities with embeddings
Conversation persistence was THE single largest gap (now fixed: migration 0004)
Content-addressed substrate is genuinely innovative vs Dify
Critical path: conversation persistence → RAG quality → project model

files.primary_topic: SSE specification with Vercel AI SDK v3 compatibility
key_signals: Ping events essential (10s intervals) for proxy/CDN timeout prevention

files.primary_topic: Vercel AI SDK vs Python backend trade-offs
key_signals: Keep Python backend with LangGraph — do NOT migrate to TypeScript
LangGraphToAISDKAdapter cost (200 lines) worth LangGraph capabilities

files.primary_topic: Cloud infrastructure design (Oracle Cloud Always Free)
key_signals: 4 OCPU ARM VM, 24 GB RAM, converged Autonomous Database
Oracle primary (9.5/10), GCP supplementary (7/10), Azure optional (7/10), AWS unsuitable (2/10)
5-stage pipeline: validate → policy → execute → log → return
Error recovery: RETRY, FALLBACK, ABORT, SKIP, REQUIRE_APPROVAL

files.primary_topic: PostgreSQL Row-Level Security for multi-tenant isolation
key_signals: Three-role model: app_user (RLS enforced), app_admin (BYPASSRLS), postgres
Parallel execution: 2-4 days, 3x speed improvement for multi-strategy RAG

files.primary_topic: Common Python backbone for all NYQST MCP servers
key_signals: 7 architectural layers: Transport, Auth, Database, Data Model, Vector/RAG, Agentic, Methods
8 shared entities, 3 abstract protocols, 4 standard index profiles

files.primary_topic: Oracle Cloud Always Free infrastructure selection
key_signals: Converged Autonomous Database: relational + vector + graph + JSON + full-text
ARM capacity shortage: multi-region retry, 7-day window
6-server architecture: Platform, Project Registry, Domain Model, RAG Service (deferred), Connectors, Admin/Ops
Three-layer architecture: Platform → Products → Enterprise Shell
Intelligence is commodity; context is asset
6 integrated modules: Research, Document, Analysis, Modelling, Knowledge, Insight
Long-running agent patterns with session bridging
PropSygnal: 5 product areas, Debt & Credit MVP foundation
RegSygnal: Regulatory Intelligence, Reporting Validation, Compliance Modelling
EMIR, MiFID II, SFTR, Basel III, BCBS 239 target regulations
Trust hierarchy: Never confidently wrong → Catch what humans miss → Faster → Easy to verify → Learns
Kernel objects: Tenancy/Identity/Access, Work Context, Artifact Substrate, Runs, Agents/Sessions, Index Service, Evidence/Claims/Decisions
Metric hierarchy: Accuracy > Trust > Efficiency > Adoption > Growth
Critical risks: T5 (Security), T1 (Extraction Accuracy), M2 (Market Timing), O1 (Team Scaling)
Regulatory references: EMIR, MiFID II, SFTR, Basel III, BCBS 239

files.primary_topic: Data Model Strategy: Domain-First with CDM Mapping
key_signals: CDM as integration layer, not foundation
CDM Helper MCP as optional service
JSON Schema / AsyncAPI for event contracts (future)

files.primary_topic: Virtual Team Architecture for AI Agent Coordination
key_signals: Engineering Playbook as single source of truth
Agent strengths: Devin (complex), Claude Code (review), Copilot (quick)
Profile-driven architecture binds strategies to named profiles
Clear boundary: LangGraph = workflow; kernel = trust/audit
Checkpoints are operational aids, NOT authoritative record

files.primary_topic: Document Processing: Tiered Pipeline with Canonical DocIR
key_signals: Decision: Tiered pipeline with adapter pattern (2026-01-26)
DocIR as canonical format stored as immutable artifact
Decision: MCP as primary tool protocol (2026-01-26)
Standard pipeline: Validate → Policy → Execute → Log → Return
4 policy templates: exploratory, standard, regulated, audit-critical
GateRules define approval requirements per policy level
Neo4j Aura free (50K nodes) for graph/domain ontologies
Validated by Dify v1.11.4 (80 tables, 565 routes) on PostgreSQL + pgvector
7 architecture principles: single source of truth, ephemeral compute, schema-on-read, everything inspectable, pointers not mutations, policy-driven levels of care, index is substrate
Master architecture document referenced throughout PRD
5-phase implementation: Contract → Planning → Deliverables v1 → Web Research → Human-in-Loop
NDM v1 (JSON AST) for deliverable markup

files.primary_topic: Superagent Next.js app shell, global state providers
key_signals: Recoil atoms and selectors for state management
Multiple analytics providers (PostHog, GA4, Twitter pixel, Facebook pixel)

files.primary_topic: Chat streaming logic, real-time message handling
key_signals: Dedicated streaming bundle for real-time chat

18 GML tags: gml-viewreport, gml-viewwebsite, gml-viewpresentation, gml-viewgenerateddocument, gml-chartcontainer, gml-row, gml-primarycolumn, gml-halfcolumn, gml-sidebarcolumn, gml-blockquote, gml-inlinecitation, gml-downloadfile, gml-components, gml-header-elt, gml-infoblockmetric, gml-infoblockevent, gml-infoblockstockticker, gml-gradientinsightbox

files.primary_topic: Global styles, Tailwind CSS v4, design tokens
SuperAgent chat session — 12+ concurrent research agents
key_signals: Plan → Reports → Deliverables pipeline (3-4 async phases)
Healer: hoists/removes widgets to correct parents
Dual design system: Geist base + Seasons Sans redesign
v0.app is code generation engine; SuperAgent is orchestrator
Three architecture patterns: monolithic → coordinator → four-tier
Frozen 181K template bundle byte-identical in Reports B & C
Multi-agent execution proven via git history

files.primary_topic: Report B deep dive (DMN-Ontology Decision Management System)

key_signals: 18 tags with strict width constraints (enforced via healer)
Citation system decouples rendering from provenance
Sentiment colors hard-coded per component type

files.primary_topic: CSS token extraction from production bundles
key_signals: 277 CSS custom properties: 231 OKLCH, 45 Hex, 1 var() alias
OKLCH primary palette (22 families) + Hex semantic (errors, warnings)
Plotly.js in chat UI, Recharts in exports (dual charting strategy)
HSLA colors hardcoded in JS: 6-stop teal (186°), green (103°), red gradients
7 stages: Research → Template → Architecture → Theme → Primitives → Sections → Widgets → Export
Multi-agent: 4 named agents (Report A git history), ~100s each phase

files.primary_topic: Report C deep dive (AAPL/MSFT/GOOG Strategic Market Intelligence)
key_signals: Four-tier architecture: ui → report → sections → widgets
Soft Brutalism design: offset shadows (4px), hover press
Data consistency: MSFT $281.7B in 5+ files proves shared brief
Seasons Sans: proprietary, 12 weights including non-standard (440, 550, 580, 650)
Substrate layer working: artifacts, manifests, pointers
LangGraph research assistant graph in place (single-agent)
Gaps: no multi-agent orchestration, no deliverable generators

files.primary_topic: Six-phase plan to achieve Superagent parity on Intelli

key_signals: LangGraph StateGraph: planner → fan_out → parallel subagents → fan_in → synthesizer
Option A: store plans as RunEvents (no new tables)
Web research tools: Brave, Jina/Firecrawl, domain allowlist
Report, Document, Slides, Website types; artifact storage; preview UI; exports
Sources/Files/Activity pane unification; deliverable selector UI; citation hover/click
Cost tracking; multi-agent parallelism billing; test strategy for orchestration
Hohfeld + defeasible deontic logic for normative representation
OIB: runtime learning from existing artifacts
217 unique files across 3 branches (doc-intelligence, async-ui, cre-workflows)
Three-agent parallel development pattern executed successfully
Expert decision procedures, governance, provenance linkage
